channel.title: The Playstation 4
channel.description:
Surprised there's not a topic already, watching the live stream here: http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2013-02-20-sonys-new-playstation-reveal
So far, a little disappointing, no backwards compatibility, graphics no better than my PC, and have yet to see the actual aesthetics of the machine.

item.title: The Playstation 4
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:24, topic:491221”][quote author=reverce link=topic=609455.msg4236994#msg4236994 date=1361621769]
Ain’t going to buy it… well I will buy it but a year after the release. Not willing to pay 500$
[/quote]
There are some pre order links up already for around £400 but truth is, no one really knows what it’s going to cost. I’ve seen rumours that they aim to keep it less than £300, not sure what that translates to in dollars.

Besides, I doubt they’ll make the same mistake as last time (release it at a higher price than any other console), that lost them millions.[/quote]
Currently E300 is a little less than $400.

Read full topic

item.title: The Playstation 4
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

The Playstation 4 looked really good. I am curious to see how Xbox responds with their Xbox 3.

It is a nice competition between the 2. I’ve never owned a Playstation, but I am considering pre-ordering the PS4.

Read full topic

Why did they add a screen on the controller? Im playing the game on my screen not on my controller.

One of the many inspirations from the WiiU…
[/quote]Clearly they didn’t know the WiiU lost Nintendo millions. (iirc)[/quote]
Err sarcasm is hard to… pronounce on the interwebz, but what I said earlier was.

item.title: The Playstation 4
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:14, topic:491221”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=609455.msg4234649#msg4234649 date=1361490139]
I was a bit disappointed that they didn’t show the actual console, however that new share feature will be interesting. So far, I’m kind of impressed.
[/quote]
Why would you see the console? You are supposed to look at the television when you play, not the hardware.[/quote]

Yeah, it’s not a major factor at all, although it is nice to have something aesthetically pleasing. I was just looking forward to seeing the console in particular, I guess I’ll have to wait a bit longer.

Read full topic

item.title: The Playstation 4
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“Christmas_tree, post:9, topic:491221”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=609455.msg4233476#msg4233476 date=1361419343]

Seems we can’t go forward. We’ve pretty much been like this with PC’s post-XP

You’re high. Just because Microsoft fails doesn’t mean technology hasn’t developed. Post-XP, the amount of ram you can get is 10x higher in a computer, and the cost of it is half as much. Obviously that’s development in technology or it wouldn’t have happened.
[/quote]

You’re high. Post-XP on the software side. 7 is just xp with updates basically.

I’m fully aware of the advancements in hardware…[/quote]
Well who the hell cares if Microsoft can’t provide? Switch to Linux. Also, Windows 7 isn’t even that bad – it’s definitely an advancement from Vista, there’s no denying that.

Read full topic

item.description:

Lin:

Guess only certain game discussion belongs here…

True story

Christmas_tree:

We’ve hit a cap with technology again. Seems we can’t go forward.

Because we’ve been dragged down by low specced consoles for so long which can’t even run games at 720p true res @ 30 fps.
Hoping now things will change
